From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

16.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.

17.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

17.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
17.str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.
From dikaios; to render just or innocent.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
17.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

17.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
17.str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
Then, therefore, since. Probably from airo; a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.

17.parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
17.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

18.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

18.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
18.str2: From kata and luo; to loosen down, i.e. to demolish; specially to halt for the night.

18.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
18.str2: To place together, commend, prove, exhibit; instrans: I stand with; To be composed of, cohere.

18.str2: Genitive case compound of emou and autos; of myself so likewise the dative case emautoi em-ow-to', and accusative case emauton em-ow-ton'.
A transgressor, law-breaker. From parabaino; a violator.
